t: For the choir director: with stringed instruments. A psalm of Asaph. A song.
God*pn is known in Judah; his*ln name is great in Israel.
His*ln tent is in Salem, his*ln dwelling place in Zion.
There*ln he shatters the bow’s flaming arrows, the*ln shield, the sword, and the weapons of war. Selah*ig
You*pn are resplendent and majestic coming*ln down from the mountains of prey.
The*ln brave-hearted have been plundered; they*ln have slipped into their final sleep. None*ln of the warriors was able to lift a hand.
At*ln your rebuke, God of Jacob, both*ln chariot and horse lay still.
And*pn you - you are to be feared. When*ln you are angry, who*ln can stand before you?
From*ln heaven you pronounced judgment. The*ln earth feared and grew quiet
when*ln God rose up to judge and*ln to save all the lowly of the earth. Selah*ig
Even*ln human wrath will praise you; you*ln will clothe yourself with*ln the wrath that remains.
Make*pn and keep your vows to*ln the Lord*s your God; let*ln all who are around him bring tribute to*ln the awe-inspiring one.
He*ln humbles the spirit of leaders; he*ln is feared by the kings of the earth.
